page.title: 07Transport in Parbold
page.content: {Car Ownership:} The use of a car was felt to be necessary for shopping trips to Southport, Wigan and Preston, as well as for visiting the nearest hospital in Ormskirk. Therefore car ownership in Parbold is quite high with most households having one car. It was stated by the people we interviewed that public transport services were not very good. {Bus:}In a recent survey in Parbold, it was found that 32 people use public transport for work more or less regularly with the main destinations being Wigan, Southport, Ormskirk and Liverpool. Since there is no secondary school in Parbold, children use the bus regularly to school. {Train:}There has been a railway station in Parbold since the 1840s and is extensively used by commuters to Southport and Manchester.
